oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Perspective on Planned BVD Control Strategy
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Grotelueschen, Dale M.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: bovine viral diarrhea virus
BVDV
control plans
herd risk
biosecurity
cost-effective
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Control of bovine viral diarrhea virus (BVDV) requires design and implementation of integrated control plans in cattle operations. Individualized plans result from assessing herd risk and risk tolerance as well as related goals of cattle enterprises. BVD control plans utilizing surveillance, biosecurity, biocontainment, and vaccination strategies can be used to achieve herd goals. Using these approaches, veterinarians can design individualized BVD control plans that both benefit cattle production and are cost-effective.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2009; 93-97
